attributes.action: Free “Low Risk” Prisoners In Order to Avoid Covid-19 Spread And Free Space.
attributes.additional_details: The coronavirus has caused prisons in Italy to riot, inmates in Brazil to flee from 4 different prisons and hundreds of prisoners have caught the illness abroad. Enable to avoid staff and prisoners to become ill, the government should take caution immediately to release prisoners with less serious cases to help staff manage the prisons and to avoid the spread of the coronavirus.
attributes.background: Help to free more space in UK prisons by releasing “low risk” prisoners and will cause less harm to the public. Prisons are at a high risk of catching the coronavirus and are currently vulnerable to the illness with fewer resources to help them survive as well as their care takers/staff.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/305604

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

NHS website: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/
UK Government website: https://www.gov.uk/coronavirus

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips
